result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah D Rudie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Ct 3 in La Crosse Co case 19CF800, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Complete a mental health assessment and follow-through with any treatment recommended
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician

Obtain Agent approval before engaging in relationships with any significant other
.

Complete a Sex Offender assessment and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Mandatory Court costs/fees are REMITTED by the Court

Pay restitution and surcharge as shown in 19CF800

Pay DOC Supervision fees - to be paid directly to the Dept of Corrections
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah D Rudie
